Package edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.user

Class Faculty

java.lang.Object
edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.user.User
edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.user.Faculty
public class Faculty
extends User
The Faculty class extends the user class it is in charge of setting the max number of courses for a faculty member which is 3, the minimum amount of courses for a faculty member is 1 we construct a faculty member, each faculty member has a first name, last name, id, email, password, and their max number of courses We also use toString to return their credential in the correct format
Author:
Ethan

    • Faculty

      public Faculty​(java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String lastName, java.lang.String id, java.lang.String email, java.lang.String password, int maxCourses)
      Constructs a Faculty object with values for all fields. IllegalArgumentException is thrown if any of the parameters are invalid.
      Parameters:
      firstName - first name of faculty
      lastName - last name of faculty
      id - faculty's id
      email - faculty's email
      password - faculty's password
      maxCourses - max courses a faculty can enroll in
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the given parameters are invalid

  • Method Details

    • setMaxCourses

      public void setMaxCourses​(int maxCourses)
      Sets the max courses for the faculty. It must be between 1 and 3.
      Parameters:
      maxCourses - max courses
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if maxCourses is invalid

    • getMaxCourses

      public int getMaxCourses()
      Gets the max courses
      Returns:
      max courses for the current Faculty, must be between 1 and 3

    • getSchedule

      public FacultySchedule getSchedule()
      Returns the faculty schedule for the faculty member.
      Returns:
      The faculty members schedule.

    • isOverloaded

      public boolean isOverloaded()
      Determines whether the faculty member is overloaded. If the number of courses scheduled is greater than the maximum number of courses the faculty member could have, then the faculty member is considered overloaded.
      Returns:
      Returns true if the faculty member has more scheduled courses than the maximum number of courses that they should have.
